One of the most popular Nintendo Switch and PC controllers sold by Amazon is on sale for a great price. The ManbaOne Wireless Controller, which released in March 2024, is up for grabs for $56 (was $70) as part of the retailer's Big Spring Sale. This matches the lowest price yet for this pro-style controller with a built-in miniature display. Yes, the ManbaOne has a terrible name, but it's a pretty awesome controller that impressed us when we tested it last year. Both the white and black models are included in the promotion.

ManbaOne Wireless Controller

$56 (was $70)

  • Works with Switch, PC, iOS, Android
  • Four remappable back buttons
  • Available in white and black
  • Hall Effect analog sticks
  • Customizable lights
  • Six-axis gyroscope
  • Built-in display
  • Trigger locks

The ManbaOne Wireless Controller packs in tons of features and is highly customizable. Its main attraction is a built-in two-inch display, which lets you quickly change settings without the need for an app or additional software. Beyond that standout feature, this is a feature-rich pro-style controller.

That means you’ll find four remappable back buttons, premium Hall Effect analog sticks to prevent drift, trigger locks for faster actuation, and a fully customizable RGB lightbar on its side. Toss in a turbo setting and six-axis gyro support, and you’ve got a controller that’s incredibly well-equipped for less than $60. As a bonus, the ManbaOne comes with its own charging dock and a set of interchangeable thumbsticks.

Both the white and black versions are discounted, and they’re both pretty stylish. The white model is a bit more mechanical, as it shows off various components underneath the faceplate, while the black model is closer to what you’d expect a traditional controller to look like.

Though the ManbaOne is on sale for a solid price, it’s not the only notable controller discounted in Amazon's Spring Sale. It's not even the only controller with a built-in display. The Turtle Beach Stealth Ultra for Xbox and PC has a built-in screen with similar features, though it's much pricier at $170 (was $200). The Asus ROG Raikiri Pro has an OLED screen, but it's largely used for customizable animations and displaying settings.

More Gaming Controller Deals at Amazon

If you're looking for more budget-friendly wireless controllers, we've rounded up a selection of other notable third-party gamepads on sale at Amazon this week. Numerous 8BitDo controllers have received price cuts, including the new 8BitDo Ultimate 2 Wireless Controller for PC and mobile and the modular Victrix Pro BFG Wireless Controller for Xbox and PC. The latter is on sale for an all-time low price of only $108 (was $180).
